page.title: 14LOCAL NEWSPAPER STOURBRIDGE
page.content: Our local paper is the Stourbridge News.It is a free{newspaper}delivered to 42,000 homes.It started six years ago and took over an older paper called the County Express which dates from the nineteenth century.It has six reporters,two being part time and a sports editor.It employs three photographers.We found that 75% of the paper is{advertising},from full pages to small private ads of three or four lines.25 full pages are house adverts. There is a competition to find a picture of Fred the prize is Â£5.There are three pages of{sports reports covering the local adult and children's teams. Here are some stories from June 1985:Township Council fights for recognition;Family's anger at 999 call delay;Money given to Clent despite fox hunting on hills.
